Reviews.Title: Great camera with one real flaw
Reviews.Author: Allan
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a few months now, and so far it's performed very well. The lack of buttons and the sweet touch screen makes for an elegant package.  I haven't tested most of it's capabilities, however.BUT, this camera inexplicably has no Auto-off function.  The sliding cover acts as a switch, and if you accidentally leave it open it enters a standby mode, but then DOESN'T SHUT OFF!  It slowly drains the battery completely.  I keep it in a case and didn't notice I had left it open, only to twice find a dead battery when I really needed a camera.  And you can't pop in a spare.  I think every digital camera I've owned had this feature.  It simply doesn't make sense to leave it off a relatively expensive camera, especially since it's so easy to leave it open unintentionally.And on the subject of that sliding cover/switch, using it creates several parallel scratches on the front of the camera- which takes away some of the elegance I mentioned.  Not a real problem, but I still wonder why Nikon created a system destined to deface itself.

Reviews.Title: Poor Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: D. Grimes
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research, and a top recommendation from Consumer Reports, I purchased this camera for my wife.  Bottom line:  I do not recommend this cameras.It had all the features I was looking for: good optical quality, thin and compact, lightweight, fast start-up time and recovery, a fixed lens (doesn't protrude out) with a good optical zoom, and it even came in red.  For these qualities, it is successful.Where it is not successful is giving a decent picture.  It exudes several poor behaviors:-Inconsistant focus.  3 out 5 are way out of focus (optical focus, not image blur) and 1 out of 5 is actually sharp.-This camera has a very slow shutter speed in low light (lots of streaking).  It must have a poor image stabilizer, too.-The flash is very inaccurate and inconsistent.  No two shots are the same, even if taken right after each other.-Most shots are too bright.  I must use exposure compensation always, which often resets back to 0.-The video is often very blurry and the focus stays fixed.  One must stop and start the video to get it to refocus.-The slide to turn it on slides out in my wifes purse and turns on, depleting the battery.-The lens is in a poor location; my wife keeps covering up the lens with her finger.-Low light pictures are almost unusable.-The panoramic mode does not process properly so there is lots of ghosting/double imagery.-Very grainy in dark areas.-The camera remains on and the battery will go dead if the USB cable is plugged into the camera but removed from a computer after downloading pictures.-The charger form factor takes up too much space on a power plug.-The color balance is either way too warm or way too cold. It doesn't seem to be able to adapt to shade properly.-The OLED touchscreen easily scratches.-Touching menu buttons is often read as wanting to take a picture, so it does. Lots of deletes.-Seems to be losing videos.-I don't get "thumbnails" of the pictures in Windows 7 x64 folders.I thought Nikon made good cameras but not so on this model.  I have a Kodak 3 MP camera from 2002 that consistently yields better pictures than this camera.  I just went back and reviewed a bunch of pictures from a staycation and found very few keepers. I really recommend you avoid this camera so I am downgrading to a single star.

Reviews.Title: Touchy touch screen
Reviews.Author: David Messent
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera except for the ability to touch the OLED screen to trigger the shutter. I found myself taking many unintentional pictures.I found there was an option to change the touch to something other that the shutter. I changed it and things are much better.

Reviews.Title: Over 4000 pictures taken in 5 weeks
Reviews.Author: Eh
Reviews.Content: Someone stated that the camera is bound to deface itself over time because of how the slide functions. True. But if you wipe the camera with a micro fiber cloth (which you should have anyway for the OLED screen)  it will slow the process. Now with that said, buy it. I promise you this is the best point and shoot on the market for the money. Also it helps if you know how "work" a camera, I.e, know what changing the iso,shutter speed actually do and things of that nature. And quick tip for the Newbie noobs, FLASH IS NOT YOUR BEST FRIEND. Learn when the flash is NEEDED. And with this camera.....well I've used the flas 3 time literaly.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use Camera
Reviews.Author: Ed D
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife and she loves it. She finds it easy to use and it takes very good pictures. My wife previously had a Cannon digital camera and did not like it very much. I thought the Cannon was fairly good but ordered the Nikon as a Christmas present. It has made her happy and therefore I'm happy.

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix s100
Reviews.Author: Rita
Reviews.Content: The camera takes wonderful photos. A little confusing for me to set up since the touch screen kept taking pictures while I was setting up and learning how to use it. Very sensitive touch screen for taking pictures. Love the red color and the size and it's light in weight.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Sarah Lumley
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing!!! The pictures re so crisp and the colors so bright! Also very fast with taking pictures was helpful when moving!! I love this camera!!

Reviews.Title: takes good pictures
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: 1 - slide opening is awkward2 - touch screen results in LOTS of unintended pictures3 - does not comes with a separate battery charger - have to use the camera to charge the batteries

Reviews.Title: NOT a good point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Carisma Tucker
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good point and shoot digital camera that will take clear pictures and be true to color DO NOT buy this! on auto mode the colors come out blueish when the white balance is set to incandescent and too sepia when in auto (for the white balance), the coolpix I had [which was stolen so I though I upgraded] took clearer and better quality pictures.However, if you are really looking for a camera that will take 3D shots - go right ahead this may be the one for you; I just wish both were seamlessly fused.

Reviews.Title: Too fragile, DO NOT BUY!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Andriy Leyba
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera based on the Consumer report review. It was in top 3 of it class. I do not know how and who made the test but according to my experience:Pros:Good quality of pictures.That's about it....Cons:1. The objective is located in top corner and if you would not hold camera properly -  you could face a lot of "finger shapes on your picture", especially if you would like to take quick shot.2. The cover which you have to slide to shut the camera when it is open located too close to the shot button, and when you are trying to close the camera you most probably will make a picture of the floor first :).3. The screen is too fragile. It cracked after several weeks not heavy use at all. Just stopped working. Then I noticed a small crack on the screen. This probably the cause, but I do not know. I was on vacation abroad and was not able to return it according to return policy .  Now sending it to Nikon for repair. I hope they will fix it under warranty.I WOULD NOT recommend this camera.Today received the email from NIKON - they what $116 fro repair.Does nor worth it.DO NOT BUY THIS!!

Reviews.Title: Beware!
Reviews.Author: Dreamer
Reviews.Content: This camera sounds good through the mouth of a salesperson. Thereafter, you will discover that it cannot correctly pick up yellow tones with hues of brown (it will turn them into a bright orange tone), and that it overcorrects skins colour with reddish hues. it fairs miserably when you shoot landscape and part of the image is very bright, where it then bleaches out the white fields to capture darker areas, if you move it a millimeter and add some darker area, it give a more accurate picture. Sorry, but too unskilled for 2013. Worst flaw is the systematic falsification of shades and hues, especially green tones.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Melanie Ridenour
Reviews.Content: I love this camera so much. It has tons of options and takes great pictures. I also love the panorama and 3D pictures. As stated in one of the other reviews, it does get a little scratched up because it is a slide on slide off camera and if you forget to turn off the camera (slide the cover closed) you find it out of battery.

Reviews.Title: great casual camera
Reviews.Author: eric parsons
Reviews.Content: I carry this camera with me on frequent bicycle rides and it is very convenient and break resistant, which I need having dropped two previous cheaper cameras that had a lens that projected out. This camera has a large touch screen and easy to use menus produces excellent pictures.

Reviews.Title: Simple camera, fine if you don't push it.
Reviews.Author: A. Tay "Private Tay"
Reviews.Content: GENERALLY I hate touch-screens, not just computers but also phones and camerasYET, I got this because it's a touch screen and not that expensiveLike that:1. the 5x optical zoom lens doesn't move out2. can choose ISO3. the flash-off remains off even after I switch off the camera4. the speed and stop are displayedDON'T like:a. touch screen is touch and go - sometimes, the lens doesn't zoom even when the T/W buttons are touchedb. the sliding cover is a bit stiff, so sometimes, it doesn't close. When this happens, you may need to slide it close before you can take a shotThe screen's good, so pictures look great(er than they are?)Buy if:you like touch-screens and don't expect to do high-speed/low-light shotsyou are used to smart-phones and want a camera with real zoom and flash and controlDon't buy if:you want to shoot in low-ight - the P310 with spot-metering and 24mm f1.8 lens is better

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Rhonda L. Fitzgerald
Reviews.Content: My husband loves taking pictures of our "very photogenic" dog with this camera! Paxton is ready for his next photo session!

Reviews.Title: Don't like every control on touch screen
Reviews.Author: Charles L Womack
Reviews.Content: I thought the touch screen would be a plus (some buttons on my old Canon have ceased to work), but it's difficult to hold the camera and access the touch screen at the same time.  For instance, try zooming with one hand holding the camera and the other touching the screen.  On my old Canon I could easily hold and zoom with one hand.  Maybe the other functions will become easier the more I use it, but I'd prefer having "hard" selections for settings.  I like having a zoom lever next to the shutter button.  While I needed a new sub-compact camera to fit in my shirt pocket, I wish I'd gotten something else.

Reviews.Title: A great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Carol Newby
Reviews.Content: I love this camera and it takes great pictures every time! Another best buy. I certainly do recommend this one!

Reviews.Title: Learning Curve but Nice
Reviews.Author: P. Yamagata "1000 Peaks"
Reviews.Content: This is a highly affordable camera that is excellent for the price. Most people may destroy it right away upon use, as it takes proficiency and wherewithal to use it, it is perhaps not designed for morons. Easy to smudge the lens right away, if one is not careful.First of all, the image quality is not superb. There is some fuzziness on the edges of the images, not as bad as with other cameras, but mostly you get what you pay for. I do my daily photo log with this, not serious photography, and so I have little worry from theft or breakage as it is cheap and easily replaceable. It carries well with a soft case in my pockets, and has been dropped with a soft case onto concrete from three feet up, no problem.It turns on and off by sliding the cover, which can be done with one hand. Touch operation is fine, fast, and reliable. Battery life is good, I can shoot for days without a new battery, maybe 500 stills. Full HD is the winner, here. I like it so much, it is the preferred camera for my video. The slim design means that I can rubber band it to the front of my rear view mirror on my car, with an object stuffed to point it ahead due to the alignment of the car rear view mirror, taking up little viewing obstruction to the driving, far less than the 5" square allowed by law (CA). A 64 GB SDXC card allows for 29 minutes at a time to run video, with some 8 hours total to store. It does get hot, though.The lens works fine, with no big loss of quality as with other cameras when zoomed in. I love the modest choices of zoom, with wide angle to sufficient for my purposes as far as telephoto. There is nothing to extend when zoomed, it's all in the camera body.I like it that older battery models are used, so I can use my former camera to charge up the batteries, as they are compatible. You may wish to have an extra battery or few available, as with video running, the battery does go out. Nice to have some beep warning when the battery is low, but with music players only still.Most or all of the settings are done by the touch screen, so you need to have nimble fingers. This is not for the inept or fumblers. The interface is obvious for Nikon users, but those unfamiliar with symbols and icons, unable to learn, should stay away from such cameras. It is sensitive, so often I cause a shot just by inadvertent handling of the camera when active, and to erase takes a couple taps. It responds instantly and precisely, no problem about that. I'll trust my treasured vacation photos and video to this camera. If you are not a professional and don't have to have DSLR quality and features, this is a great buy!

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera 2 minor issues
Reviews.Author: Kionna McClary
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS CAMERA!!!! The color as shown is exactly the same in person, bright purple. It takes very fast photos as soon as you click the button or touch the screen. The photos/videos come out so crisp and clean. This camera can take really good photos in a dark room so there is no issues with having dark photos unless you set it to do so. Battery life great especially if you don't keep in on the whole time. My ONLY two minor issues with this very cute camera is that you have to make sure and shut it off and watch your hands and body because its a very sensitive touch screen. You will have random photos of your nose, ceilings and just crazy stuff because me and who ever takes the photos will always hit the touch screen. Also if you don't mind a lot of silver scratches on the camera from sliding the lens back and fourth. This is surely a great everyday camera to buy. Everyone that takes a photo for me ask where I get this awesome camera.

Reviews.Title: Mostly good
Reviews.Author: Thomas L. Brower "TLB"
Reviews.Content: The pictures are great and the menu is fairly simple.  Our problem is it has a hair shutter button.  It's nearly impossible to handle it or turn it off without taking pictures of your hands or nose or floor.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: D Kuromoto
Reviews.Content: Took on a recent trip and photos came out fab.  Very light weight and easy to use.  can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic small camera!
Reviews.Author: Phbug
Reviews.Content: Nikon does it again!  This is an easy-to-carry jewel that takes excellentphotos under any conditions.  I love it!  A terrific choice.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: 142Percent
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what I wanted when I was looking for a camera.  Own the S80 and so we bought the S100 for our new employee.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for my travel needs.
Reviews.Author: TR Koncher
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera because of all of its features in a compact format.  Great Amazon service and delivery from this vendor.  Only complaint I have it that Nikon needs to fix the problem of the lens cover opening in you pocket and draining the battery charge.

Reviews.Title: Nice but easily damaged
Reviews.Author: Debra
Reviews.Content: I like this camera a lot, but watch out because the way the screen is made on the back, it's easy to chip the corners.  I chipped mind the first day I had it by dropping it.  The wrist strap doesn't have a little thing to push down and tighten on your wrist, so the camera slipped right off my hand.  I fixed this by putting a large bead on the strap that I can push down.I have looked all over the web and cannot find a protective skin for this camera.  It should come with one.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good, but bad design
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Takes good pictures, but the cover doesn't stay in place and you end up taking a lot of random pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great travel camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas Truett "stoneyt"
Reviews.Content: I had an S80 and took it everywhere and it finally began to exhibit flaws in the CCD or Optics so I guess I just wore it out. The S100 is just as good a camera but smoother in operation and faster, too.

Reviews.Title: This is a fun camera.
Reviews.Author: Suzanne M. Roush
Reviews.Content: It is so thin, my husband carries this camera in a generic case in the front pocket of his pants everyday with no problems.  The OLED display screen is beautiful and exceptionally clear.  He says the only "con" is that the cropping feature is not as versatile as other Nikon cameras.  He bought the red one!

Reviews.Title: love my camera
Reviews.Author: Hazel
Reviews.Content: Received on time.I have to get use to using it is exactly as you said it was.I love the. fact I can write on my pictures and everything I am very happy with it.Thank you.I would recommend it to someone else if they were buying a camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Charles J. Phelan
Reviews.Content: I chose Nikon because I have found that it has been the best camera for taking pictures of moving objects or while moving and taking pictures.

Reviews.Title: A Tradesmen's Dream
Reviews.Author: Rich Renouf
Reviews.Content: The NUMBER ONE feature of this little camera is the sliding cover which protects the lens from the elements. I am a welder and mechanic and have managed to jam all of the fragile multi-stage lenses of many manufactures in the past. I photograph the inner workings of various broken machinery pieces while dangling from a nylon harness deep inside or on top of some mechanical device.The sliding cover takes some getting used to with the "trigger finger" shutter but in my instance, this is definite "plus" as it is always better to have too many pictures than missing that perfect shot. The only custom feature I added was a glued on 2 x 2 patch of leather to the sliding cover which enables me to open it with a gloved hand. Said cover glides firmly to protect the lens and while it does leave beauty marks, it certainly does protect the lens.

Reviews.Title: attractive and successful
Reviews.Author: erkan güllü
Reviews.Content: According to the price of the product is very successful,I think it deserves a five star,hdmi cable in the box, and it would be better if the screen saver,I would recommend the product ...honest dealer salesman ...Thank you for your quick and clean cargo.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: mickmiller
Reviews.Content: This has turned out to be a great camera. It was highly rated by Consumer Reports. The shipping information left something to be desired. FedEx "Smart Post" means it is coming to my local post office. Until I experienced it, I guess I would have to be an employee of FedEx to know it. The significance of this is I could have had the product in my hands at least one day sooner if I would have advised that it was coming by post office. I may have had the option to have it held in my post office for my pick up. Lesson Learned!

Reviews.Title: Great Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: Gaart Skarsgård
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use and especially love the large display on the back.  The icons are large enough to see by "old eyes" like mine.  I am not a camera nut and just set mine up to do everything automatically; that way it's "dumb proof" for me.  It is very compact and lightweight.  I have not used the video function yet but all the pictures I have taken are very clear; once you figure out which resolution setting to select.I was able to find this one at about half price because it was used/refurbished.  When I got it, it looked like it had never been used.....SCORE!!

Reviews.Title: Super camera
Reviews.Author: H. Etchell "haretanan"
Reviews.Content: I have many cameras from early small digitals to large digitals and this little camera is fantastic. I really like the panoramic feature. The quality of photos is great. I can't say enough about this camera.Nikon COOLPIX S100 16 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom NIKKOR ED Glass Lens and 3.5-Inch OLED Touchscreen (Red)

Reviews.Title: quick question?????
Reviews.Author: chris
Reviews.Content: does this package come together....meaning does it come with the box and all the accessories... i am considering to buy it and it is great product overall......

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S100
Reviews.Author: mr.-m
Reviews.Content: Pluses - This camera is very compact, easily fitting into one's pocket.  The OLED viewing screen is very large relative to the size of the camera.  Battery life is quite good.  Image quality is very good, but not in the same league as SLR style  cameras.Minuses - the LCD screen washes-out in sunlight.  The paper owners manual isn't very informative about camera operation.  An owners manual on CD is supplied, but not very convenient for use in the field, or for those without a computer.  It takes some time and experimentation to figure out the various menus and features on the touch screen.  There is no optical viewfinder.Overall - If one desires an inexpensive compact camera, this may be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: No complaints, yet.
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: It's a good/decent camera that gets the job done. Im just worried that the big OLED will get scratched. Overall i like the size and the color does get a little smudges here and there.

Reviews.Title: Loved it until the battery went bad
Reviews.Author: Health4Real
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera 2 months (conveniently outside the window of time during which I can return the item), and just noticed a blinking red light. The troubleshooting manual told me that the battery is faulty.  I am wondering if "From a Top Shelf or Amazon" is willing to exchange the camera or offer to repair it?

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S100 a Rip Off
Reviews.Author: Rick3406
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a Xmas Present for my wife. We took it on a cruise and used if for about a week before I cracked the touch screen LCD. I did not drop the camera. It was in a carry bag which must have swung up against some hard object. I think the LCD screen must be of some inferior design as over the years never had a similar problem with cell phones etc even when dropped. I mailed it back to Nikon,for repair. Nikon stated it was not covered by warranty and wanted $108 repair. I declined to have it repaired as I would not want it for even $100. It is impractical to use with a case, as the shell slides out to take a pic. If it needed a case it should have come with the camera or have been recommended in the instructions which came with the camera.

ProductInfo.Features:
Ultra-slim body design (less than 1-inch)
16 effective megapixel CMOS sensor for better pictures in low light and fast framing rates
5x optical Zoom-NIKKOR ED glass lens, 28-140mm (35mm equivalent) for superior image quality
Touch control with huge, high resolution 3.5-in. OLED monitor with 820,000-dot Clear Color display and anti-reflection coating
Full HD (1080p) movie recording with Optical zoom, stereo sound and special effects
ProductInfo.Name: Nikon COOLPIX S100 16 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom NIKKOR ED Glass Lens and 3.5-Inch OLED Touchscreen (Gold)
